publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-6865 Stuart McMillan: Inverclyde’s Most Outstanding Recruits—That the Parliament congratulates the eight Inverclyde pupils who have secured employment during an awards ceremony that took place in Greenock Town Hall; notes that Lucia Giuntoli, 18, of Greenock Academy, Rory McEwing, 18, of Greenock Academy, and Ilaria Moretti, 17, of St Columba’s, will be joining RBS Mortgage Centre, Jade Thomson, 16, of Greenock Academy and Brian Kershaw, 17, of Notre Dame, are going to work at T-Mobile, Christina Owen, 17, of Notre Dame, is going to Inverclyde Council’s community learning and development department, Arman Hussain, 16, of Greenock Academy, has been hired by Milne Craig Accountants, and Nicola Black, 17, of Notre Dame, is heading to Inverclyde Council’s education department; acknowledges the achievements of the eight pupils in receiving these employment opportunities, and wishes them every success in their new roles. Supported by: Bill Kidd*, Bob Doris*, Aileen Campbell*, Sandra White*, Stewart Maxwell*, Angela Constance*
